      • drawableMouseClick

        public void drawableMouseClick​(Drawable e)
        Description copied from class: DrawingSurface
        This is a callback method that will be called if a mouse button is pressed while pointing to a drawable on the drawing surface. The parameter is the drawable that was clicked on. The mouse click check is made in Z-order from front to back. This means that if more than one Drawable is in the X,Y location of the click, the topmost one will be the one detected.

        Subclasses should override this method in order to process mouse clicks on their Drawables.

        Overrides:
        drawableMouseClick in class DrawingSurface
        Parameters:
        e - The Drawable that was clicked on
        See Also:
        DrawingSurface.checkForDrawableMatch(int, int)
